column5: YOU WILL FIND in the DIARIES a LOT of POLITICS AND EVEN MORE CATS     THE PERSON who MAKES the FIRST COMMENT WILL GET TWO CATS EVERY PERSON WHO COMMENTS WILL GET A CAT     RULES IN THE DIARY WHEN YOU FIND SOMETHING in the DIARY that you LIKE YOU CAN REPOST IT AS COMMENT in the DIARY  PRESIDENT JOE BIDEN President Biden says he plans to set the refugee admissions cap at 125000 for the coming fiscal year.  Breaking. Statement from President Biden: "Today I am revising the United States' annual refugee admissions cap to 62500 for this fiscal year. This erases the historically low number set by the previous administration of 15000."  President Biden is scheduled to deliver the keynote address during this month's graduation ceremonies at the U.S. Coast Guard Academy on May 19.  President Biden: "Do we want to give the wealthiest people in America another tax cut or do you want to give every high school graduate the ability to earn a community college degree?"  The Biden admin is quietly laying the groundwork for a long-term increase in food aid for tens of millions of Americans without going through the ordeal of a fight with congressional Republicans. https://t.co/cqhkdaQxpL  Biden: "Today on World Press Freedom Day we celebrate the fierce bravery of journalists everywhere. We recognize the integral role a free press plays in building prosperous resilient and free societies. And we recommit to protecting and promoting free independent ... media."  The Biden admin has launched a text-message tool to link Americans with COVID shots near them.People in the U.S. can text their ZIP code to GETVAX (438829) or VACUNA (822862) to see locations near them with available doses. https://t.co/NEqStvx1so  JILL BIDEN In her first 100 days first lady Jill Biden shows she's not her predecessor.Biden has so far traveled to 14 states and taken more than a dozen solo work-related trips since February — more than her husband has on his solo domestic travels. https://t.co/N0NSmkWT6I  SAMANTHA POWER Samantha Power has been sworn in as Biden's United States Agency for International Development (USAID) Administrator by Vice President Harris.  BILL NELSON Bill Nelson has been sworn in as NASA Administrator by Vice President Harris according to the pool report.  KETANJI BROWN JACKSON If Biden nominee Ketanji Brown Jackson is confirmed by the Senate to the U.S. Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit she would join just five other Black women out of 286 judges currently sitting on a federal appeals court bench. https://t.co/mHtiFm51UW  SEN. ELIZABETH WARREN Sen. Elizabeth Warren to CBS on the American Jobs Plan: "I am prepared to go to budget reconciliation. I'm somebody who thinks that the filibuster should not be to give Republicans a veto on things that this country needs."  LIZ CHENEY A House Republican suggests that other House Republicans might not want Liz Cheney in leadership because she won't lie about the election. https://t.co/ABGOLsuFMu  CINDY MCCAIN Cindy McCain: The Republican-backed recount in Arizona is "ludicrous.""The election is over … Biden won" McCain said adding: "I know many of them don't like the outcome but you know elections have consequences."  https://t.co/sALKMYML9U  PROUD BOYS CANADA Proud Boys Canada a far-right group added to the country's list of terrorist entities has dissolved itself.The families include at least one child separated from his or her parent at age 3 and at least two women separated from their children in 2017. https://t.co/bPRGPQfVMM  NEW YORK & NEW JERSEY & CONNECTICUT Beginning May 19 most COVID capacity restrictions will end across New York New Jersey and Connecticut.Restaurants museums theaters Broadway retail and shops are all included in the lifting of such restrictions.  MINNESOTA The Minnesota attorney general is seeking a harsher prison sentence for Derek Chauvin due to the "particular cruelty" he showed in the murder of George Floyd. https://t.co/3sSfiZUVn7  LOS ANGELES COUNTY Los Angeles County public health authorities on Sunday reported no new deaths related to COVID-19. https://t.co/iwHtzRiEtE  ARIZONA An Arizona Republic reporter was ejected from Republicans' audit of presidential ballots after he photographed ex-AZ state Rep. Anthony Kern — a Republican — reviewing ballots. Kern who's own name is on the ballots he's auditing has spread election lies.https://t.co/weVPNBEARM
